channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid: Hotel thought prom-goers had negative tests before spike
item.description: More than 50 positive cases are linked to a Year 11 graduation party at a hotel.

item.title: Bridgend mother in court charged with murder of her two-year-old son
item.description: Natalie Steele has been charged with the murder of two-year-old Reid Steele.

item.title: Afghanistan: Welsh woman trying to help translator flee Kabul
item.description: Anna Prince struck up a friendship with the man after they started chatting about art on Facebook.

item.title: Green Man: Tears and joy as festival returns against Covid odds
item.description: Tickets for the festival sold out in minutes back in May, despite Covid uncertainty.

item.title: One-Day Cup: Glamorgan beat Durham at Trent Bridge to win first knockout trophy
item.description: Glamorgan beat Durham by 58 runs to win the One-Day Cup at Trent Bridge - their first knockout trophy.

item.title: NHS Wales: Waiting times hit record levels
item.description: Numbers waiting for hospital treatment hit record levels and A&E waiting times are the worst on record.

item.title: DVLA: Apology over continuing driving licence renewal delays
item.description: Industrial action and social distancing requirements have led to continuing delays, says the DVLA.

item.title: Censor: Video nasty film explores the power of horror
item.description: The film Censor, set during the 80s, delves into impact of the lurid horror movies from that era.

item.title: Climate change: Families in Wales urged to plant more trees
item.description: Wales' deputy climate change minister admits "we're way behind" tree-planting targets.

item.title: Covid: £551m extra funding for NHS and social care
item.description: The money is being allocated for ongoing costs and tackling waiting times.

item.title: Covid: Carer shortage 'biggest worry' for watchdog
item.description: The care watchdog says recruitment issues could threaten domiciliary services.

item.title: Hell's Mouth: Man drowned after saving friend's daughter
item.description: Stephen Hulsmeier was unresponsive when he was brought ashore, an inquest hears.

item.title: Covid: Green Man welcomes back festival fans
item.description: Buzzard Buzzard Buzzard’s Tom Rees said it was a “landmark” marking music's return to south Wales.

item.title: 'All your sacrifices have just been in vain, sweetheart'
item.description: Families affected by the Afghan war reveal their sadness and anger at the Taliban's swift resurgence.

item.title: Porthcawl: Off-duty police officer found missing man in ditch
item.description: PC Amy Rowlands found the dementia patient 30 hours after he was reported missing from his care home.

item.title: Plaid's ex-leader has not been friends with successor for years
item.description: Leanne Wood says she thinks Adam Price went about his Plaid leadership challenge the wrong way.

item.title: Afghanistan: Activists call for Wales to take more refugees
item.description: Campaigners take to the streets of Cardiff to welcome Afghan refugees to the Welsh capital.

item.title: CCTV catches moment car crashes off A494 on to farmer's land
item.description: A farmer's CCTV captures the moment a car crashes on the A494 onto his property.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney: Hollywood owners recognised Wrexham's 'huge potential'
item.description: Hollywood stars Rob McElhenney and Ryan Reynolds recognised the "huge potential" of Wrexham says manager Phil Parkinson.

item.title: WRU considers hosting Rugby Championship games
item.description: The WRU is exploring the possibility of hosting Rugby Championship games involving the southern hemisphere's top teams in Cardiff.

item.title: One-Day Cup: Glamorgan captain Kiran Carlson delight at creating history
item.description: Glamorgan captain Kiran Carlson admitted he was chuffed to have created history after leading his side to their first limited overs cup final victory.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney: Inside track of Wrexham's Hollywood takeover
item.description: How a phone call from Portsmouth's chief executive in May 2019 led to Wrexham's Hollywood takeover.

item.title: One-Day Cup: Watch the best shots from Glamorgan's Kiran Carlson
item.description: Watch the best shots from Kiran Carlson, hitting 82 runs off 59 deliveries to help Glamorgan win the One-Day Cup final, beating Durham by 58 runs at Trent Bridge.

item.title: Nifer y bobl ar restrau aros ysbytai Cymru ar ei lefel uchaf
item.description: Mwy o bobl yn aros am driniaeth ysbyty sydd ddim yn frys yng Nghymru nag erioed o'r blaen.

item.title: Mam o flaen Llys y Goron ar gyhuddiad o ladd ei mab
item.description: Bu farw Reid Steele, 2, yn yr ysbyty yn dilyn digwyddiad mewn tŷ ym Mhen-y-bont ar Ogwr.

item.title: Gwefan Comisiynydd 'nôl yn fyw wyth mis ar ôl hacio
item.description: Cafodd staff eu cloi o'u systemau fis Rhagfyr wedi i hacwyr gymryd rheolaeth o'r wefan ac amgryptio data.

item.title: Oriel: Bywyd gwyllt ar stepen y drws
item.description: Y ffotograffydd Bethan Vaughan Davies sy'n rhannu lluniau o fywyd gwyllt ei bro

item.title: Morgannwg yn curo Durham i ennill y Cwpan Undydd
item.description: Morgannwg wedi llwyddo i ennill eu tlws cyntaf ers 2004 gyda buddugoliaeth o 58 o rediadau yn Trent Bridge.
